title: How to Make Spicy Chicken and Cauliflower Egg Noodles

steps.headline: Fill a saucepan with clean water.
steps.description: Put it on stove at medium heat. When the water starts simmering, put the noodle cakes into it.

steps.headline: Stir the noodles continuously.
steps.description: Keep stirring the noodles with the help of a spatula, making sure that the noodles are not sticking to the bottom of the saucepan.

steps.headline: Note down the time.
steps.description: When noodles start boiling, boil them for 2 to 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Rinse the noodles.
steps.description: When the noodles are completely boiled, take them out of the water. Drain and rinse them with clean, cold water. Set aside.

parts.name: Preparing the Ingredients for the Noodle Sauce

steps.headline: Cook scrambled eggs.
steps.description: Put the eggs into a saucepan. Scramble them with a fork or spatula. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes on medium-low heat until they are ready. Also add a pinch of salt to eggs, to taste.

steps.headline: Slice the chicken breasts.
steps.description: Using a sharp knife, cut the chicken breasts into slices.

steps.headline: Boil the chicken with some spices.
steps.description: Fill a small saucepan with clean water. There should be enough water to cover the chicken breasts slices. Add a few spices to it and boil until the the water is no longer left.

steps.headline: Chop the capsicums (bell peppers) and cauliflower.
steps.description: Using a sharp knife, chop capsicums and cauliflower. Stir fry them for a few minutes and set aside.

parts.name: Combining the Noodle Sauce and Noodles

steps.headline: Put a large frying pan onto the stove top.
steps.description: Add the scrambled eggs, boiled chicken breast slices, chopped cauliflower and capsicums. Also add the red chili powder, black pepper powder and salt.

steps.headline: Stir fry the ingredients.
steps.description: Then add the prepared noodles, chili sauce and soy sauce to the pan. Stir through. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes and turn off the flame (heat).

steps.headline: Transfer the spicy chicken and cauliflower egg noodles to a beautiful large dish.
steps.description: Decorate with boiled egg halves. Sprinkle some chopped parsley across the whole dish for garnish.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Diners can help themselves to as much of the dish as they'd like. Have a happy meal!

text: Boiling the Noodles Fill a saucepan with clean water. Put it on stove at medium heat. When the water starts simmering, put the noodle cakes into it. Stir the noodles continuously. Keep stirring the noodles with the help of a spatula, making sure that the noodles are not sticking to the bottom of the saucepan. Note down the time. When noodles start boiling, boil them for 2 to 3 minutes. Rinse the noodles. When the noodles are completely boiled, take them out of the water. Drain and rinse them with clean, cold water. Set aside. Preparing the Ingredients for the Noodle Sauce Cook scrambled eggs. Put the eggs into a saucepan. Scramble them with a fork or spatula. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes on medium-low heat until they are ready. Also add a pinch of salt to eggs, to taste. Slice the chicken breasts. Using a sharp knife, cut the chicken breasts into slices. Boil the chicken with some spices. Fill a small saucepan with clean water. There should be enough water to cover the chicken breasts slices. Add a few spices to it and boil until the the water is no longer left. Chop the capsicums (bell peppers) and cauliflower. Using a sharp knife, chop capsicums and cauliflower. Stir fry them for a few minutes and set aside. Combining the Noodle Sauce and Noodles Put a large frying pan onto the stove top. Add the scrambled eggs, boiled chicken breast slices, chopped cauliflower and capsicums. Also add the red chili powder, black pepper powder and salt. Stir fry the ingredients. Then add the prepared noodles, chili sauce and soy sauce to the pan. Stir through. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes and turn off the flame (heat). Transfer the spicy chicken and cauliflower egg noodles to a beautiful large dish. Decorate with boiled egg halves. Sprinkle some chopped parsley across the whole dish for garnish. Serve immediately. Diners can help themselves to as much of the dish as they'd like. Have a happy meal!
